thread.title: Arsene Wenger reveals what could drive him away from Arsenal this summer | GiveMeSport
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger reveals what could drive him away from Arsenal this summer | GiveMeSport

title: Arsene Wenger reveals what could drive him away from Arsenal this summer | GiveMeSport
text:
Arsene Wenger reveals what could drive him away from Arsenal this summer Published 24/7 
It's no secret that Arsene Wenger is in the final year of his contract at Arsenal, and his reluctance to rush into a new deal has caused some serious speculation over what his next move will be. 
With a new two-year deal placed on the table by the club's hierarchy, the veteran tactician is still keeping them hanging with one thing seemingly keeping him from committing his future beyond this summer. 
Wenger himself has previously stated that he wants to ensure the club's star players put pen-to-paper before he does, but now according to the Mirror he has opened up to his close friends about the biggest reason for him holding off on staying. Article continues below 
It seems that the bubble coat wearing manager is aware of the animosity towards him from the stands, and witnessed his side being booed off the pitch after Tuesday night's 2-1 defeat to Watford first hand. 
Currently serving a touchline ban, he had to take a seat to watch his side take a huge blow in their title hopes, his friends and allies that were sat amongst him apparently said that nobody would be thick skinned enough to not let that level of abuse affect them. Article continues below
